title: Rumor messages
data:
A user has suggested this page be **merged** with *"[Source:True rumors](/wiki/Source:True_rumors "Source:True rumors")"*

**Rumors** are clever hints about many aspects of [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack"). This table provides explanations for the rumors you can find in [fortune cookies](/wiki/Fortune_cookie "Fortune cookie"), random floor [engravings](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving"), talking [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact"), etc. This table only lists the true ones, so if you see a rumor that isn't in this list, either it is a false rumor, or it comes from a version of NetHack other than 3.4.

Many rumors have multiple meanings. Feel free to fix or add to the explanations.

Some [public servers](/wiki/Public_server "Public server") (in particular [NAO](/wiki/NAO "NAO")) add more rumors to their database.

| Rumor                                                                                                                                  | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| A blindfold can be very useful if you're telepathic.                                                                                   | You can see the monsters on your level that have brains if you are blind and telepathic. Intrinsic telepathy can be gained by eating a floating eye, a master mind flayer, or praying at an altar. One way to become blind is to apply a blindfold or towel, and another is to apply an expensive camera at yourself with [.](/wiki/Dot "Dot").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| A candelabrum affixed with seven candles shows the way with a magical light.                                                           | A necessary step in performing the invocation on the vibrating square. Apply the uncursed candelabrum with seven candles affixed on the vibrating square. Off the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square"), it has a larger light radius than a lamp.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| A cream pie has two uses: food... and entertainment.                                                                                   | It can be thrown at monsters to blind them.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| A crystal plate mail will not rust.                                                                                                    | A crystal plate mail is made of glass, so it will not rust, corrode, burn, or rot.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| A katana might slice a worm in two.                                                                                                    | Attacking a [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm") in the middle with a sharp weapon has a chance of cutting it in two, leaving you with two to fight.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| A magic vomit pump could be useful for gourmands.                                                                                      | While there is no such item, if you are satiated and need to eat something to gain an intrinsic or other effect, wearing an amulet of magical breathing will allow you to finish without threat of choking. If you can find another way to vomit, that will also increase your hunger.*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*A [ring of hunger](/wiki/Ring_of_hunger "Ring of hunger") can serve a similar purpose, though leaving you with much less nutrition. |
| A nymph knows how to unlock chains.                                                                                                    | Polymorphing into a nymph will allow you to remove heavy iron balls chained to you. Hostile nymphs might also steal the ball, so one way to get rid of a heavy iron ball is to drop all inventory items, pick up the ball, and hit a nymph.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| A [potion of blindness](/wiki/Potion_of_blindness "Potion of blindness") lets you see invisible things.                                | You can see the monsters on your level that have brains if you are blind and telepathic. Telepathy can be gained by eating a floating eye.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| A priest can get the gods to listen easily.                                                                                            | Donating gold to a [priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") can have several useful effects, depending on the amount donated and your experience level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| A priestess and a virgin you might be, but that [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") won't care.                                         | There is an old myth that a virgin can tame a unicorn, which will rest its head in her lap. Not so in NetHack.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| A [ring of conflict](/wiki/Ring_of_conflict "Ring of conflict") is a bad thing if there is a [nurse](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse") in the room. | Wearing a ring of conflict causes even peaceful monsters to hit you and each other. If a nurse hits you while you are not wearing armor, wielding a weapon, or wearing a ring of conflict, it can increase your current hit points and your maximum hit points.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| A short sword is not as good as a long sword.                                                                                          | A long sword generally causes more damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| A succubus will go farther than a nymph.                                                                                               | A nymph can seduce you and steal items. A succubus (or an incubus if you are female) can seduce you and remove armor (even cursed armor) and increase or decrease an attribute, then possibly steal money (if not tame).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| A wand can exorcize a past explorer's ghost.                                                                                           | Using the wand of undead turning on the corpse from a [bones files](/wiki/Bones_files "Bones files") will revive the corpse and bring the ghost back into the original body if it was adjacent.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Acid blobs should be attacked bare-handed.                                                                                             | Hitting an acid blob or other acidic monster can damage you and cause your weapon to corrode. Hitting with bare hands will spare your weapon, but you can still take damage from the splash.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Affairs with nymphs are often very expensive.                                                                                          | Nymphs seduce you and steal objects.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Afraid of nymphs? Wear a [ring of adornment](/wiki/Ring_of_adornment "Ring of adornment").                                             | If you are wearing a ring of adornment, a nymph will steal it instead of stealing other stuff.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| Afraid of your valuables being stolen? Carry more junk!                                                                                | When a random item is stolen, if you carry lots of worthless items, the probability that a valuable item will be taken is lower.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Always be aware of the phase of the moon!                                                                                              | If you play NetHack when the moon is full, your luck is increased by one. If you play during a new moon, a message says, "Be careful! New moon tonight," but your luck is not affected. Playing on a Friday the 13th will decrease your luck by one.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Always sweep the floor before engraving important messages.                                                                            | When you engrave in a location that already has an engraving, you can either add to or replace the current message. One way to erase a message is to engrave an underscore using [\_](/wiki/Underscore "Underscore").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Amulets of Yendor are hard to make. Even for a wand of wishing.                                                                        | If you wish for the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), you will get a [cheap plastic imitation](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| An [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak") is useful against magic.                                                             | An elven cloak gives level 1 [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation"), the same as most other [cloaks](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"). In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), this gave level 3 magic cancellation, so the cloak (and this rumor) was more useful.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| An [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk") can be a confusing sight.                                                               | An umber hulk has a gaze attack which can confuse you if you are not blind.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| As Crom is my witness, I'll never go hungry again!                                                                                     | One of the [troubles](/wiki/Trouble "Trouble") that can be fixed by prayer is hunger.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Asking about monsters may be very useful.                                                                                              | The whatis command (from the [/](/wiki/Slash "Slash") key) can give you more info on a monster type that may help you defeat it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Attack long worms from the rear -- that is so much safer!                                                                              | You can damage and sometimes kill a long worm without taking damage yourself if you attack its tail. But you may cut it into two long worms, unless you attack the very end of its tail.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Attacking an [eel](/wiki/Eel "Eel") where there is none is usually a fatal mistake!                                                    | Eels are hidden in the water. If you try to attack where there isn't one, instead of attacking you may fall in the water. Press [F](/wiki/F "F") to make sure you really attempt to fight.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Bandaging wounds helps keep up appearances.                                                                                            | Wearing a mummy wrapping while invisible makes you visible again.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Bashing monsters with a bow is not such a good idea.                                                                                   | Hitting with a bow or other [launcher](/wiki/Launcher "Launcher") can only do one or two points of base damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Be careful! The Wizard may plan an ambush!                                                                                             | Even after you kill the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), he may cast a [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") spell to surround you with monsters.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Be nice to a nurse: Put away your weapon and take off your clothes.                                                                    | If a nurse hits you while you are not wearing armor, wielding a weapon, or wearing a ring of conflict, it can increase your hit points and your maximum hit points.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Being digested is a painfully slow process.                                                                                            | Monsters like [trappers](/wiki/Trapper "Trapper") and [purple worms](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm") will digest you to death over several turns. Wearing a [ring of slow digestion](/wiki/Ring_of_slow_digestion "Ring of slow digestion") will make the monster spit you out.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Blank scrolls make more interesting reading.                                                                                           | They are interesting because you can write any known scroll type on them with a magic marker.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| Blind? Catch a [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye")!                                                                      | Floating eyes can't immobilize you if you are blind. Eating a floating eye corpse also gives intrinsic telepathy, which is only useful if you are blind.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Booksellers never read scrolls; they might get carried away.                                                                           | You may find a [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") in a book shop; reading it may cause you to [steal](/wiki/Stealing_from_shops "Stealing from shops") any unpaid items you may be carrying, plus the scroll itself. Reading any other non-blank scroll will (at best) leave you in debt to the shopkeeper for the cost of the scroll.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Chemistry 101: Never pour water into acid.                                                                                             | Dipping a [potion of acid](/wiki/Potion_of_acid "Potion of acid") into water causes an explosion that does 1 to 10 points of damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Concise conquest: Control, confuse, conjure, condemn.                                                                                  | A cryptic description of the following strategy: Control the floor for safety, confuse yourself, read a scroll of create monster to conjure a large number of acid blobs, then kill and sacrifice (condemn) them.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Conserve energy, turn off the lights.                                                                                                  | If you leave a dark level and forget to turn your lamp off, it may run out of fuel before you realize that it is on.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Digging up a [grave](/wiki/Grave "Grave") could be a bad idea...                                                                       | You may find items by digging up a grave, but it can cause several bad effects, such as abusing wisdom, hurting your alignment if lawful, or summoning the grave's occupant.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Dilithium crystals are rare indeed.                                                                                                    | Dilithium crystals are the rarest and most valuable gems. In Star Trek, dilithium crystals were used in the warp engines.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| Dogs are attracted by the smell of tripe.                                                                                              | [Tripe rations](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration") are dog food. Throwing a tripe ration at a dog or cat will tame it, and carrying a tripe ration will make you pet dog or cat follow you more closely.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Dogs are superstitious; they never step on cursed items.                                                                               | Your [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") won't usually step on a cursed item. If it does, it will do so 'reluctantly'.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| Dogs of ghosts aren't angry, just hungry.                                                                                              | Throwing food at a dog can make it [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| Don't forget! [Large dogs](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog") are MUCH harder to kill than little dogs.                                      | Large dogs have more hit points and do more damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Don't lash out at people while blinded.                                                                                                | [Blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") doesn't reduce your combat skills, but you need to be wary of attacking the wrong monster.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Don't mess with shopkeepers, or you'll get the Guild after you.                                                                        | Stealing from a shop may summon [Keystone Kops](/wiki/Keystone_Kop_\(monster_class\) "Keystone Kop (monster class)"), and if applicable, anger the [Minetown watch](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Dragons never whip their children; they wouldn't feel it!                                                                              | A [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") does no damage to [dragons](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") and other [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") monsters.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Eat your [carrots](/wiki/Carrot "Carrot"). They're good for your eyes.                                                                 | Eating a carrot cures blindness.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Eating a freezing sphere is like eating a yeti.                                                                                        | Both can give you cold resistance (freezing spheres don't leave corpses in recent versions, though they can still be eaten if you polymorph into a purple worm or other engulfing digester).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Eating a killer bee is like eating a scorpion.                                                                                         | Both can be poisonous, and both have a high chance of giving poison resistance relative to their level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Eating a tengu is like eating a nymph.                                                                                                 | Both can give the [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis") intrinsic.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| Eating a wraith is a rewarding experience!                                                                                             | Eating a fresh wraith corpse may cause you to gain a level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Eating unpaid leprechauns may be advantageous.                                                                                         | Eating a leprechaun corpse may give you the [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis") intrinsic, allowing you to escape from a shop.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Elbereth has quite a reputation around these parts.                                                                                    | If you stand still on a spot with [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") engraved, most monsters will flee.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Elf corpses are incompatible with the sandman, and at times the gods as well.                                                          | Eating an elf corpse can give you [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"). If you are an elf, eating an elf is cannibalism and will hurt your alignment.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| Elven cloaks cannot rust.                                                                                                              | Items made of cloth can't rust.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Elves can help you feel less tired.                                                                                                    | Eating an elf corpse can give you [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Even evil players have a guardian angel.                                                                                               | When you enter the [astral plane](/wiki/Astral_plane "Astral plane") (the last level of the game) a tame angel appears, unless you wear a ring of conflict or have a bad [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"), which causes four hostile angels to appear.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Ever fought with an enchanted tooth?                                                                                                   | Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon") while wielding a worm tooth turns it into a [crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Ever tried reading while confused?                                                                                                     | Reading scrolls while confused changes the effect of the scroll. For example, reading a [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") will teleport level, and [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") will provide rustproofing or fireproofing.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Ever tried to put a troll into a large box?                                                                                            | [Trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") have a chance of coming back to life after being killed. If you lock one in a large box or chest, it won't. There are other ways to do it, like throwing the corpse in water or tinning it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Ever wondered why one would want to dip something in a potion?                                                                         | Dipping items in potions can have several effects. For example, dipping an uncursed item into holy water blesses it, or dipping it into unholy water curses it. Dipping a potion into another potion is known as [alchemy](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Expensive cameras have penetrating flash lights.                                                                                       | Apply an [expensive camera](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera") at an adjacent monster to blind it. Then you can run away, or zap at it or throw things at it more safely from a distance. Cameras don't work as light sources to light up dark areas.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| Extra staircases lead to extra levels.                                                                                                 | Some levels have three staircases, rather than the normal two. The long stairs lead to other dungeon branches, such as the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"), [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban"), or [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Fiery letters might deter monsters.                                                                                                    | You can permanently engrave '[Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth")' with a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") in one turn.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| For a good time engrave 'Elbereth'.                                                                                                    | If you engrave '[Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth")', then stand on the engraving, most monsters won't attack you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Gems are too precious to be thrown away carelessly.                                                                                    | Throw valuable [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems") at co-aligned [unicorns](/wiki/Unicorns "Unicorns") to increase your luck. Throwing them at other monsters is usually a [bad idea](/wiki/Bad_idea "Bad idea").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Getting hungry? Stop wearing rings!                                                                                                    | Wearing rings slightly increases the rate at which you need food, except for a ring of slow digestion, which greatly decreases it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Getting too warm? Take off that Amulet of Yendor and stay away from the exit!                                                          | If you wear the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") in the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes"), it becomes warmer as you get closer to the portal that exits the level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Gods expect the best from their priesthood.                                                                                            | Keeping your [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") high will give better results when you pray. Don't dig up [graves](/wiki/Headstone "Headstone"), kick [altars](/wiki/Altars "Altars"), etc. if your role gets penalized for that.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Gods look down their noses at demigods.                                                                                                | When you kill the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") or perform the [Invocation](/wiki/Invocation "Invocation"), the "demigod" flag is set for your character, which greatly increases your prayer timeout, and makes your god harder to please.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Gods love cats and dogs.                                                                                                               | [Sacrificing](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") animal corpses at an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") can lead to your god helping you. Trying to sacrifice the corpse of your pet only angers the altar's god.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Got a question? Try rec.games.roguelike.nethack.                                                                                       | [This](/wiki/Rgrn "Rgrn") is the official Usenet news group for questions and answers about NetHack. One way to get there is from [http://groups.google.com](http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| Grave robbers sometimes get rich.                                                                                                      | Up to five cursed items can be found by digging in a [grave](/wiki/Headstone "Headstone").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Guy Montag keeps his scrolls in a bag.                                                                                                 | Guy Montag is the protagonist in *Fahrenheit 451*. Keeping scrolls in a [bag](/wiki/Bag "Bag") can protect them from fire, and an [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack") can protect them from water.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Handle your flasks carefully -- there might be a ghost inside!                                                                         | [Quaffing](/wiki/Quaffing "Quaffing") a [milky potion](/wiki/Milky_potion "Milky potion") (even after you have identified it) can make a ghost appear.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Holy water has many uses.                                                                                                              | Some of them: cursed items dipped into holy water become uncursed; uncursed items become blessed; sickness can be cured and wisdom and constitution can be improved by quaffing.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Horses trust their riders, even when not so deserved.                                                                                  | You can ride a horse or other [mount](/wiki/Mount "Mount") onto a [trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap"), and it will continue to "trust" you (it won't lose tameness) unlike if you displace a pet into a trap.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Hunger is a confusing experience for a dog!                                                                                            | When a tame dog or other [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is too hungry it becomes confused and may hit you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| I once knew a hacker who ate too fast and choked to death.                                                                             | Eating when satiated can cause you to choke and die. If you are "having a hard time" getting it down, stop eating unless you are wearing an [amulet of magical breathing](/wiki/Amulet_of_magical_breathing "Amulet of magical breathing").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| I smell a maze of twisty little passages.                                                                                              | There are several levels that are mazes, rather than the standard levels with rooms and passages. This phrase is from the games Adventure and Zork.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| I wish I never wished a wand of wishing. (Wishful thinking.)                                                                           | Zapping a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") allows you to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for an item, but if you wish for a wand of wishing, you have a 90% chance of receiving a cancelled wand which is completely useless, and a 10% chance of getting a depleted one from which only a single wish can be [wrested](/wiki/Wresting "Wresting") (usually with great effort).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| I wouldn't advise playing catch with a giant.                                                                                          | [Giants](/wiki/Giants "Giants") may throw [boulders](/wiki/Boulders "Boulders") at you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| I'm watching you. -- The Wizard of Yendor                                                                                              | After you kill the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), he keeps re-appearing.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Ice boxes keep your food fresh.                                                                                                        | Place a corpse in an [ice box](/wiki/Ice_box "Ice box") to keep it from rotting.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| If you are being punished, it's done with a deadly weapon.                                                                             | If you are chained to a [heavy iron ball](/wiki/Heavy_iron_ball "Heavy iron ball"), you may want to wield it because even though it hits less often, it will do heavy damage when it does hit.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| If you kill the Wizard, you get promoted to demi-god.                                                                                  | Killing the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") sets the [demigod](/wiki/Demigod "Demigod") flag in the game's code.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| If you need a wand of digging, kindly ask the minotaur.                                                                                | The maze levels of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") often have a [minotaurs](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur") which may carry a [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| If you want to hit, use a dagger.                                                                                                      | [Daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") hit more often than many other weapons, but other weapons often do more damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| If you want to rob a shop, train your dog.                                                                                             | You can train your dog or cat by throwing food at it when it drops items at your feet. You can safely steal from a shop by entering with your pet, waiting for it to pick up an item, then leaving. Sometimes the pet will drop the item outside the shop.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| If you're lost, try buying a map next time you're in a shop.                                                                           | A [scroll of magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping") can map the level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Inside a shop you better take a look at the price tags before buying anything.                                                         | If you don't have enough gold to pay for the items you pick up in a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop"), you can just drop them again. But if you use or damage shop items, the [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") will demand payment before you can leave. If you don't have enough money, you may have to sell some of your own items.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| It is bad manners to use a wand in a shop.                                                                                             | [Zapping](/wiki/Zapping "Zapping") a wand in a shop may damage the shop items, hit the shopkeeper, or make a hole in the floor or wall. Also, zapping unpaid wands incurs a [usage fee](/wiki/Usage_fee "Usage fee").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| It is dangerous to visit a graveyard at midnight.                                                                                      | [Undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") creatures do extra damage between midnight and 1:00 am according to the computer's clock.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| It is not always a good idea to whistle for your dog.                                                                                  | Blowing a [whistle](/wiki/Whistle "Whistle") can wake sleeping monsters.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| It is rumored that the Wizard has hired some help.                                                                                     | The wizard can cast [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| It is the letter 'c' and not 'e' that changes status to statue.                                                                        | [Cockatrices](/wiki/Cockatrices "Cockatrices") and [chickatrices](/wiki/Chickatrices "Chickatrices") can turn you and others to stone. [Floating eyes](/wiki/Floating_eyes "Floating eyes") can temporarily freeze you. In the ASCII version of nethack, cockatrices and chickatrices are represented by 'c', and floating eyes by 'e'.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| It might be a good idea to offer the unicorn a ruby.                                                                                   | Throw valuable gems at co-aligned [unicorns](/wiki/Unicorns "Unicorns") to increase your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| It would be peculiarly sad were your dog turned to stone.                                                                              | You get a [peculiarly sad](/wiki/Pet "Pet") feeling when a pet is turned to stone.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| It's a \`d' eats \`d' world.                                                                                                           | 'It's a dog eat dog world' is a saying refers to fierce competition. If you eat a dog or cat, you will aggravate monsters. In the ASCII version, 'd' represents a dog.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Just because it says READ ME doesn't mean you should.                                                                                  | It's a [random scroll name](/wiki/Randomized_appearance#scroll "Randomized appearance").
