Reading unidentified scrolls can be a bad idea.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Keep your armors away from rust.                                                                                                       | Metal armor can rust in water or [rust traps](/wiki/Rust_trap "Rust trap").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Keep your weaponry away from acids.                                                                                                    | Metal weapons can corrode if you hit an [acid blob](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob") or other acidic monster.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| Kill a unicorn of your color and you kill your luck.                                                                                   | Killing a [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") of your own [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") damages your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). If you are [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful"), don't kill white unicorns, if [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral"), gray, and if [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic"), black.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Leather is waterproof. Ever see a cow with an umbrella?                                                                                | Leather weapons or armor won't rust.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Leprechauns are the most skilled cutpurses in this dungeon.                                                                            | If a [leprechaun](/wiki/Leprechaun "Leprechaun") hits you while you have gold in your main inventory, or while you are standing on gold, he may steal some and then teleport. Drop your gold and move or put it in a bag before attacking, or, if it's too late, throw your gold away from the leprechaun.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Lizard corpses protect against cockatrices.                                                                                            | If a [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") hits you and makes you start slowing down, eat a [lizard corpse](/wiki/Lizard_corpse "Lizard corpse") (or an acidic corpse) quickly, or you will turn to [stone](/wiki/Stone "Stone"). Lizard corpses never rot, so you can always carry one with you. Don't keep it in a [bag](/wiki/Bag "Bag"), though, because you may not have time to get it out. Also, a carried lizard corpse reduces the cockatrice's hissing attack success rates at new moon.                                                                                                                                             |
| Money lost, little lost; honor lost, much lost; pluck lost, all lost.                                                                  | There may be more [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") in the game than you could ever spend or carry. Keep your [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") good. Don't lose your courage (but never be afraid to run away).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Most monsters can't swim.                                                                                                              | Staying in or over water can protect you from many monsters, but expose you to others. Also, if you somehow get a monster over water (zapping a wand of fire at ice, for example), it might drown. If you throw a [troll](/wiki/Troll "Troll") corpse into water, it won't bother you again.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Music hath charms to affect the stubborn drawbridge.                                                                                   | To lower the drawbridge on the castle level, play the five-note [passtune](/wiki/Passtune "Passtune") on a [musical instrument](/wiki/Musical_instrument "Musical instrument"). You can learn the passtune by sacrificing or praying on an alter, or through trial and error as in the MasterMind game. Notes can be in the range A - G. Choose five notes. Any note in the right sequence causes a gear to turn. A correct note in the wrong sequence causes a tumbler to click.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Music hath charms to soothe the savage beast.                                                                                          | Playing a [wooden flute](/wiki/Wooden_flute "Wooden flute") may calm [snakes](/wiki/Snake_\(monster_class\) "Snake (monster class)"). A [magic flute](/wiki/Magic_flute "Magic flute") may put monsters to sleep. A [harp](/wiki/Harp "Harp") may calm [nymphs](/wiki/Nymphs "Nymphs"). A [magic harp](/wiki/Magic_harp "Magic harp") may tame monsters.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Never attack a guard.                                                                                                                  | If you stay in a vault for too long, the [vault](/wiki/Vault "Vault")'s [guard](/wiki/Guard "Guard") will appear and tell you to drop your gold. Attacking him may be murder. He's pretty strong. If you tell him you are [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus"), he will leave you alone.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Never ride a long worm.                                                                                                                | This works in Herbert's Dune, but not in NetHack, especially since this rumor predates riding. "You can't [saddle](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle") such a creature."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Never use your best weapon to engrave a curse.                                                                                         | [Engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with a bladed weapon can dull the weapon, unless it's a non-cursed [athame](/wiki/Athame "Athame").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| No easy fighting with a heavy load!                                                                                                    | Fighting while [burdened](/wiki/Burdened "Burdened") decreases your effectiveness.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Not all boots were made for walking.                                                                                                   | [Levitation boots](/wiki/Levitation_boots "Levitation boots") cause you to float in the air instead. [Jumping boots](/wiki/Jumping_boots "Jumping boots") are for walking and jumping.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Nurses are trained to touch naked persons: they don't harm them.                                                                       | If a [nurse](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse") hits you while you are not wearing armor, wielding a weapon, or wearing a [ring of conflict](/wiki/Ring_of_conflict "Ring of conflict"), it can increase your current and your maximum [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Nymphs can unlink more than your chain mail.                                                                                           | Polymorphing into a nymph will allow you to remove heavy [iron balls](/wiki/Iron_ball "Iron ball") chained to you. Hostile nymphs might also steal the ball if you carry it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Once your little dog will be a big dog, and you will be proud of it.                                                                   | Monsters, including pets, gain experience as they kill other monsters or quaff [potions of gain level](/wiki/Potions_of_gain_level "Potions of gain level"). For example: Little dogs turn into dogs, then large dogs; kittens turn into housecats, then large cats; ponies turn into horses, then warhorses; and various [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") can turn into [orc-captains](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain").                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Opening a tin is difficult, especially when you attempt it bare handed!                                                                | Opening cursed or uncursed [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin") takes time. Wielding some weapons, like daggers or athames, makes it take less time. Applying a [tin opener](/wiki/Tin_opener "Tin opener") will open tins quickly.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Orcs and killer bees share their lifestyle.                                                                                            | They are both spawned in groups.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Orcs do not procreate in dark rooms.                                                                                                   | In NetHack the orcs, like many other monsters, do not produce offspring at all. The only monsters that are capable of "procreation" are the [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") ones, perhaps with the addition of "binary fission" monsters (black and brown pudding, blue jelly, etc.) and the parastic green slime that can take control of the host. A heroine polymorphing into an oviparous monster can lay eggs that can hatch, producing tame monsters.                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Plain nymphs are harmless.                                                                                                             | If you [cancel](/wiki/Cancel "Cancel") a [nymph](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph"), she will look plain and won't be able to seduce you and steal stuff.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Playing D\&D may be helpful.                                                                                                           | NetHack is roughly based on Dungeons and Dragons.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Playing Gauntlet might be enlightening in some situations.                                                                             | Gauntlet is a fantasy role playing arcade game for up to four players. Some phrases in NetHack originated in Gauntlet, such as "Wizard needs food badly." Also, the message "wizard/elf, all your powers will be lost" leaks some information on your intrinsics.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Playing billiards pays when you are in a shop.                                                                                         | [Shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeepers "Shopkeepers") avoid being in the direct line of fire of a wand or spell, but you may be able to bounce one off a wall.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Polymorphing a shopkeeper might make you safer.                                                                                        | Polymorphing a peaceful monster or shopkeeper angers it. You may polymorph it into something wimpy and easy to kill, or nasty and dangerous.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Polymorphing your dog probably makes you safer.                                                                                        | If you zap a [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") at your pet, or make it step on a [polymorph trap](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap"), you may change it into a more powerful pet.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Potions don't usually mix, but sometimes...                                                                                            | You can dip potions into other potions to transform them, or cause other effects. This is called [alchemy](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Psst! It's done with mirrors!                                                                                                          | Applying a [mirror](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") to a monster may frighten it. Applying it to a nymph may make the nymph take the mirror, rather than stealing some other item. Breaking a mirror (like by kicking, throwing, or with a wand of striking) hurts your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). You can kill Medusa if you have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Put on a ring of teleportation: it will take you away from onslaught.                                                                  | Teleporting can be a good way of getting out of trouble.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Rays aren't boomerangs, of course, but still...                                                                                        | A [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang") may return to you when thrown. Ray wands, such as wands of fire and death, bounce off walls. Zapping straight at a wall can [rebound](/wiki/Rebound "Rebound") straight back at you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Read the manual before entering the cave -- you might get killed otherwise.                                                            | There is no one NetHack manual, but the Help system is, um, helpful, and there are many spoilers. And you will get killed a lot. Dying isn't something to be ashamed of, but dying the same way twice may be.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| Reading Herbert might be enlightening in one case.                                                                                     | Some items in NetHack are based on Frank Herbert's Dune series, such as [long worms](/wiki/Long_worms "Long worms") and [crysknives](/wiki/Crysknives "Crysknives").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Reading Tolkien might help you.                                                                                                        | Many items in NetHack are based on J.R.R. Tolkien's Lord of the Rings series, such as red-eye shields and white-hand shields.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| Reading scrolls after drinking booze can give confusing results.                                                                       | Drinking a [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze") is one way to cause [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion"). Several scrolls have different effects if read while confused. Teleportation becomes level teleportation. Enchant armor or weapon provides protection from fire, rust, etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Riding a dragon can be an uplifting experience.                                                                                        | Several types of tame monsters can be ridden. You'll have to put a [saddle](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle") on it first. Dragons can fly over water and traps. Don't try to ride a cockatrice!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Rust monsters love water. There are potions they hate, however.                                                                        | Throwing harmful potions can be a good last resort weapon to fight off monsters.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Sacks protect contents from temperatures up to 452 degrees fahrenheit.                                                                 | 451 degrees Fahrenheit is the temperature at which paper is supposed to burn. Place scrolls, potions, and spellbooks in [sacks](/wiki/Sack "Sack") to protect them from fire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| Scrolls fading? It's not the heat, it's the humidity.                                                                                  | Getting a scroll or spellbook wet can cause the ink to fade, making it blank. You can use a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") to write on a blank scroll or spellbook, turning it into any known type.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Shopkeepers accept credit cards, as long as you pay cash.                                                                              | [Credit cards](/wiki/Credit_card "Credit card") are for picking locks, not for paying shopkeepers.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Shopkeepers can spot a tourist a mile away with those Hawaiian shirts.                                                                 | If you are wearing a visible [Hawaiian shirt](/wiki/Hawaiian_shirt "Hawaiian shirt") (or are a low-level tourist), a shopkeeper will charge you more. Wearing it under other armor is fine.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Shopkeepers can't tell identical twins apart.                                                                                          | If you get killed on a level with an angry shopkeeper, then play a new game as the same character and encounter that bones level, the shopkeeper will still be angry.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Shopkeepers don't read, so what use is engraving in a shop?                                                                            | Shopkeepers aren't scared by an engraved [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Shopkeepers have incredible patience.                                                                                                  | A shopkeeper will wait forever for you to pay. He just won't let you leave the shop until you do.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Shopkeepers might raise their prices for tourists.                                                                                     | If you are wearing a visible [Hawaiian shirt](/wiki/Hawaiian_shirt "Hawaiian shirt"), a shopkeeper will charge you more. Wearing it under other armor is fine.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| Shopkeepers value money more than revenge.                                                                                             | After robbing a shop, you can return and pay to pacify the shopkeeper. You can pay by throwing money to the shopkeeper.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Some monsters can be tamed. I once saw a hacker with a tame dragon!                                                                    | Many monsters can be tamed with a [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming") or a spell of [charm monster](/wiki/Charm_monster "Charm monster"). Also, your pet may be polymorphed into almost any monster type.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Someone once said that what goes up < might come down >.                                                                               | [<](/wiki/Angle_bracket "Angle bracket") is historicaly the symbol for up stairs, and [>](/wiki/Angle_bracket "Angle bracket") is the down stairs. Most levels have at least one of both. Also, you can throw items up, they will fall on your head and hit you. If you do that with a [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") corpse, you will become a statue "killed by elementary physics".                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Someone's been spiking the pits!                                                                                                       | Some pit [traps](/wiki/Traps "Traps") have spikes in the bottom that cause additional damage. Some spikes are poisoned and may cause [instant death](/wiki/Instant_death "Instant death") if you aren't [poison resistant](/wiki/Poison_resistant "Poison resistant").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Sometimes monsters are more likely to fight each other than attack you.                                                                | If you wear a [ring of conflict](/wiki/Ring_of_conflict "Ring of conflict"), monsters may attack each other. But peaceful or tame monsters may also attack you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Spinach, carrot, and jelly -- a meal fit for a nurse!                                                                                  | Eating tins of [spinach](/wiki/Spinach "Spinach") or [lumps of royal jelly](/wiki/Lumps_of_royal_jelly "Lumps of royal jelly") increases your strength. [Carrots](/wiki/Carrot "Carrot") can cure [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Tainted meat is even more sickening than poison!                                                                                       | Poison decreases strength. Eating old, tainted meat can kill you if you don't cure yourself in a few moves (pray, extra healing, unicorn horn, etc.).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Telepathy is just a trick: once you know how to do it, it's easy.                                                                      | Eating a [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye") gives you [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"). You can also get it from your god at an altar. When blind, you can see monsters with brains on your level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| The Leprechaun Gold Tru$t is no division of the Magic Memory Vault.                                                                    | Many levels have gold [vaults](/wiki/Vault "Vault") also known as Magic Memory Vaults, small 2x2 rooms with no doors. This rumor has nothing to do with leprechaun halls, which it predates.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| The Wizard finds death to be quite an experience.                                                                                      | The wizard comes back to life to attack you again after you kill him. Each time, he comes back one experience level stronger.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| The best equipment for your work is, of course, the most expensive.                                                                    | The more expensive an item is in a shop, the more likely it is to be valuable. For example, if an unidentified lamp costs 15 zorkmids in a shop, it is a normal [lamp](/wiki/Lamp "Lamp"), but if it costs 45 zorkmids, it is a [magic lamp](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp"). Also, an unidentified scroll that costs 20 zorkmids is an identify scroll, but if it costs 300 zorkmids it is charging, genocide, punishment, or stinking cloud.                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| The gods don't appreciate pesky priesthood.                                                                                            | Don't pray too often or you will anger your god. You can find out if you can safely pray with a [potion of enlightenment](/wiki/Potion_of_enlightenment "Potion of enlightenment") or by sacrificing at an altar (you won't feel 'hopeful' if praying is OK.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| The gods will get angry if you kill your dog.                                                                                          | Killing your pet does serious damage to your [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") and [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") (but does *not* increase anger unless you kill it with a trap). It takes a while for your alignment and Luck to recover, though sacrificing a non-co-aligned unicorn at a co-aligned altar can help.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| The magic marker is mightier than the sword.                                                                                           | A [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") is one of the most valuable items you can have, since with it you can turn a blank scroll into any scroll, or a blank spellbook into any known spellbook. There is a chance of writing unknown spellbooks.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| The moon is not the only heavenly body to influence this game.                                                                         | The phase of the moon affects your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). Some monsters act differently at night, for example, gremlins can steal [intrinsics](/wiki/Intrinsics "Intrinsics") at night. There are several other aspects affected by time. See the time, date, and moon phase spoiler. Also, nymphs and succubi/incubi can affect you because of your attraction to their heavenly bodies.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| The orc swings his orcish broadsword named Elfrist at you. You die...                                                                  | Although there is no named weapon named Elfrist in vanilla NetHack, the named artifact [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist") is an Elven broadsword that does special damage to orcs.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| The secret of wands of Nothing Happens: try again!                                                                                     | When a wand has 0 charges, there is still a chance that another zap will wrest one additional charge, after which the wand turns to dust. Hint: to repeatedly zap a wand with no charges, adjust it to inventory slot 'z', then hold down the [z](/wiki/Z "Z") key. Engraving works for non-directional wands, too.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| There has always been something mystical about mirrors.                                                                                | Breaking one hurts your luck. Showing one to a nymph may save you from losing something valuable. Floating eyes can freeze themselves. Medusa turns herself to stone. Monsters might be frightened. Several other things can happen.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| There is a Mastermind deep in the dungeon.                                                                                             | You may have to play [MasterMind](/wiki/Passtune "Passtune") to open the drawbridge on the [castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") level. Or just bring a wand of striking and a way to levitate. This rumor has nothing to do with master mind flayers, which it predates.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| There is a big treasure hidden in the zoo!                                                                                             | Zoo rooms have lots of gold. This rumor has nothing to do with Sokoban, which it predates.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| There is more magic in this cave than meets the eye.                                                                                   | Magic traps can be hidden. Being blind shows you monsters if you have telepathy. Many items have non-obvious uses, at least not obvious to unspoiled players.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| There is no harm in praising a large dog.                                                                                              | You can tame a dog or cat by throwing it food. Or you can chat with it, but that is neither harmful nor helpful, but purely diagnostic.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| There is nothing like eating a mimic.                                                                                                  | You will change into a gold piece for a while.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| There once was a Knight named Lancelot who liked to ride with his lance a lot.                                                         | Knights are good at riding horses and using lances. Mounted melee with a lance has a chance of [jousting](/wiki/Lance#Jousting "Lance") the target.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say a gelatinous cube can paralyze you...                                                                                         | When one touches you, you can freeze for a short while, unless you have free action.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that calculating your donations lets you choose your blessings.                                                               | [Donating](/wiki/Aligned_priest#Chatting_to_a_priest "Aligned priest") different amounts of money to a priest gives different benefits.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that Juiblex is afraid of a wand of digging.                                                                                  | A wand of digging is useful for escaping most monsters that engulf you. It won't keep Jubilex from making you sick, although if you zap it from inside him, he'll only have 1hp left.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that Medusa would like to put you on a pedestal.                                                                              | If [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa") looks at you, you will be turned to stone, if you aren't prepared.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that Vlad lives!!!... in the mazes.                                                                                           | [Vlad](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler "Vlad the Impaler") is a vampire that lives in a tower and has the [Candelabrum](/wiki/Candelabrum "Candelabrum").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| They say that 'Elbereth' is often written about.                                                                                       | Engrave it on the floor for protection from most monsters.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that a bag of holding can't hold everything.                                                                                  | Putting a wand of cancellation in one causes you to lose the bag and its contents, so never put an unidentified wand in one. Don't put a bag of holding or a charged bag of tricks in a bag of holding. Also, [unique items](/wiki/Unique_item "Unique item") can't be placed into a bag.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that a blessed tin of quasit meat is a quick meal.                                                                            | Eating a [quasit](/wiki/Quasit "Quasit") can give you poison resistance, but it doesn't increase your speed. Any blessed tin opens quickly.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that a cat avoids traps.                                                                                                      | Pets avoid traps, and whine near them if leashed.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that a cave spider will occasionally eat cave spider eggs.                                                                    | It would probably have to be tame and starving.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that a clever wizard can have stats: 18/\*\* 24 18 24 24 24.                                                                  | The Strength statistic can be raised up to 18/\*\* naturally, such as by eating giant corpses. For [humans](/wiki/Human "Human"), other stats have a normal maximum of 18, so to get the listed stats, you could wear +6 gauntlets of dexterity, a +6 helm of brilliance, a +6 ring of adornment, and you could increase the remaining 18 stat to 24 as well with a +6 ring of gain constitution.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that a clove of garlic makes a good talisman if handled right.                                                                | Hitting an undead monster while wielding a [clove of garlic](/wiki/Clove_of_garlic "Clove of garlic") scares the monster.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that a cursed scroll of teleportation could land you in trouble.                                                              | A cursed [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") can cause a [level teleport](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport"), which may take you deeper in the dungeon than you are prepared for. Most of the time, however, it will take you up.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that a diamond is another kind of luck stone.                                                                                 | Throwing valuable gems at a *co-aligned* unicorn can boost your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that a dog can be trained to fetch objects.                                                                                   | Tame pets can pick up items and then drop them. Throwing food at it when it drops something at your feet trains it to do that more often ([apport](/wiki/Apport "Apport")). This is a safe way to steal from shops.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that a gelatinous cube makes a healthy breakfast.                                                                             | Eating a [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube") has a 10% chance of granting fire, cold, sleep, or shock resistance, but since it is acidic it will do some damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that a giant gets strong by eating right, try it!                                                                             | Eating a giant corpse can boost your strength. Note that you may want to eat even giant zombie and giant mummy corpses; if the corpse isn't tainted, you can get the strength increase. If it is tainted, you can immediately apply an uncursed unicorn horn multiple times to cure the food poisoning. Note that there is a small chance that you will die before successfully curing the poisoning.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that a grid bug won't hit you when you cross it.                                                                              | [Grid bugs](/wiki/Grid_bugs "Grid bugs") can't move or attack on a diagonal.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| They say that a lembas wafer is a very light snack.                                                                                    | A [lembas wafer](/wiki/Lembas_wafer "Lembas wafer") weighs a quarter of a food ration's weight, but gives just as much nutrition and you can eat it much faster.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| They say that a loadstone has a strange attraction and is not bad luck.                                                                | [Loadstones](/wiki/Loadstones "Loadstones") are heavy, can't be dropped when they are cursed, and are usually generated cursed. They are so heavy that they can't be kicked far, so you may want to kick gray stones before picking them up. But it is not bad luck; a cursed gray stone could also be a luckstone, which reduces your Luck when carried (or a flint or touchstone).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that a lock pick by any other name is still a lock pick.                                                                      | Possibly a hint that you can get in trouble for unlocking doors in [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown") even if you use a skeleton key. Also, a [credit card](/wiki/Credit_card "Credit card") can be used as a lock pick. Also may refer to the fact that Samurai know lock picks as "osaku".                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that a lucky amulet will block poisoned arrows.                                                                               | An [amulet versus poison](/wiki/Amulet_versus_poison "Amulet versus poison") grants poison resistance.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| They say that a mirror will freeze a floating eye but you can still see it.                                                            | Apply a mirror at a floating eye will cause its own gaze to freeze itself, but since you can still see it, hitting it will still freeze you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| They say that a neutral character might get Giantslayer.                                                                               | Most artifact weapons come with a specific alignment. Your god may give you an artifact of the correct alignment at an altar. [Giantslayer](/wiki/Giantslayer "Giantslayer") is an example of a neutral artifact.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that a polymorph trap is magic and magic protection prevents it.                                                              | If you trigger a [polymorph trap](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") while magic resistant, you will "feel momentarily different, but will be unaffected."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| They say that a potion of healing can cancel a potion of sickness.                                                                     | [Dipping](/wiki/Dip "Dip") [missiles](/wiki/Missile "Missile") into a [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness") [poisons](/wiki/Poison "Poison") them. Dipping them into a [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing") removes poison.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that a potion of monster detection sometimes works both ways.                                                                 | Quaffing a cursed [potion of monster detection](/wiki/Potion_of_monster_detection "Potion of monster detection") aggravates monsters, probably waking sleeping monsters near you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that a sink looks different from high above the floor.                                                                        | If you are levitating and move over a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink"), you fall to the floor, even if you are wearing a cursed ring of levitation or cursed boots of levitation.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that a summoned demon could improve your game.                                                                                | Quaffing from [fountains](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"), or dipping items in them, can summon a [water demon](/wiki/Water_demon "Water demon"), which may grant a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish"). However, dangerous outcomes are far more likely.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that a tin of wraith meat is a rare dining experience.                                                                        | [Wraith](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith") corpses can't be tinned in the current version, but could in earlier versions. Eating one may cause you to gain an experience level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that a unicorn might bring you luck.                                                                                          | Throwing valuable gems at *co-aligned* [unicorns](/wiki/Unicorns "Unicorns") increases your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| They say that a wand of cancellation is like a wand of polymorph.                                                                      | Both wands of cancellation and polymorph have a base cost of 200 in a shop. Polymorph can change items into other items of the same class. Cancellation can turn potions into water and make scrolls and spellbooks blank.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that a wand of locking can close more than just doors.                                                                        | You can lock chests and large boxes or make a door appear in an empty doorway.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| They say that a wand of polymorph can change your game.                                                                                | Piling up items and zapping them with polymorph can change them into other items of the same class. This is called [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling"), and is one way to get items you need.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
