| They say that a wizard is even more powerful the second time around.                                                                   | The Wizard of Yendor can summon a duplicate of himself, leaving you with two powerful wizards to fight. Also, after killing him, he comes back from the dead to fight again, one experience level higher than before.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that a xorn knows of no obstacles when pursuing you.                                                                          | [Xorns](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn") can move through rock, walls, doors, boulders, etc., but they can't cross water.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that abusing a credit card could shock you sooner or later.                                                                   | [Credit cards](/wiki/Credit_card "Credit card") can pick locks, but the locks on a chest, door, or large box may be trapped with one of several different traps, one of which can be an electric charge. This rumor has nothing to do with the Platinum Yendorian Express Card, which it predates.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| They say that amulets, like most things, can be deadly or life saving.                                                                 | A cursed [amulet of strangulation](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation") is one way to die. An [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving") keeps you from dying.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that an altar can identify blessings.                                                                                         | Drop an item on an altar while nonblind to discover its blessed/uncursed/cursed status.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that an ooze will bite your boots and a rock mole will eat them.                                                              | A gray ooze can rust metal objects, a black pudding corrodes iron and copper, and a rock mole can eat them. Some boots are made of metal.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that an unlucky hacker was once killed by an exploding tin.                                                                   | Cursed tins can explode when opened.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that antique dealers are always interested in precious stones.                                                                | You can sell gems at general shops and jewelers. Shopkeepers will always charge you for a gem as if it is valuable, but only buy them as if they are worthless glass (unless the gem is identified).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that bandaging one's wounds helps to keep up one's appearance.                                                                | Wearing a [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping") while invisible makes you visible.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that booze can be diluted but not cancelled.                                                                                  | You can dilute a potion of booze by dipping it in water, but zapping it with cancellation only makes it uncursed. Most other potions when canceled become water.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| They say that by listening carefully, you can hear a secret door!                                                                      | Applying a [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope") to a hidden door discovers the door.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| They say that carrots and carrot juice may improve your vision.                                                                        | Eating a carrot cures blindness. Carrot juice doesn't exist in Nethack.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that cave spiders are not considered expensive health food.                                                                   | Eating a [cave spider](/wiki/Cave_spider "Cave spider") may grant [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"). Cave spiders aren't poisonous.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| They say that demigods must leave behind their prized earthly possessions.                                                             | When you win the game and ascend and achieve demigod status, you leave the game and can have your possessions identified.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that disturbing a djinni can be a costly mistake.                                                                             | "You disturbed me, fool!" is the message you get when rubbing a [magic lamp](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp") or quaffing a [smoky potion](/wiki/Smoky_potion "Smoky potion") produces a hostile djinni.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| They say that dragon scales can be quite enchanting.                                                                                   | If you wear [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales") and then enchant them with a [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor"), they turn into [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), which is good armor.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that dropping coins into a fountain will not grant you a wish.                                                                | No, but drinking from a fountain may attract a water demon that may grant a wish, or may attack. Also, dipping items in a fountain may cause you to lose some gold.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that dwarves lawfully mind their own business.                                                                                | [Dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)") will often be peaceful if the player character is lawful.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| They say that eating a bat corpse will make you batty, for a while.                                                                    | Eating a [bat](/wiki/Bat "Bat") corpse can [stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun") you for several turns.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that eating a cram ration is a smart move.                                                                                    | Cram rations provide the same weight-to-nutrition ratio as a food ration, but you can eat them quicker.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that eating blue jelly is cool if you don't fight the feeling.                                                                | Eating a [blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly") may grant cold or poison resistance.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that escaping a dungeon is only the beginning of the end.                                                                     | If you take the up stairs from level 1 with the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") in your possession, you arrive at the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth"). From there you go the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air"), then [Plane of Fire](/wiki/Plane_of_Fire "Plane of Fire"), [Plane of Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water"), and finally the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), where you can sacrifice the Amulet to win the game.                                                                                                                     |
| They say that feeling an unexpected draft of air is sort of a breakthrough.                                                            | If a monster breaks through a door on your level, you may "feel an unexpected draft."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that finding a cursed gray stone is always bad luck.                                                                          | An unidentified gray stone is either a loadstone, a luckstone, a touchstone, or a flint stone. A cursed loadstone is very heavy and can't be dropped. A cursed luckstone decreases your luck. A cursed flint stone may misfire when fired or slip when thrown. A cursed touchstone can destroy gems. Except in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") piles, a cursed gray stone is always a loadstone.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| They say that gaining a level is an experience that can raise your sights.                                                             | If a [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level") is cursed, it lifts you through the ceiling. Otherwise you gain an experience level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that garter snake meat rarely tastes good but it's still healthy.                                                             | Garter snakes aren't poisonous, so they can be eaten. It will grant no intrinsics.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| They say that gauntlets of dexterity have a hidden enchanted touch.                                                                    | [Gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity") increase (or decrease, if the enchantment is negative) your dexterity by their enchantment.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that going to heaven is just another way of escaping the dungeon.                                                             | Going up from level 1 lets you escape the dungeon, unless you have the Amulet of Yendor, which lets you eventually get to the Astral Plane where you can win. Also, if you [levelport](/wiki/Levelport "Levelport") to level -10 or above, you prematurely go to heaven.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that golden nagas are law-abiding denizens as long as you are too.                                                            | [Golden nagas](/wiki/Golden_nagas "Golden nagas") are lawful, so they will most likely be peaceful if you are lawful.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that gremlins can make you feel cooler than you are now.                                                                      | [Gremlins](/wiki/Gremlins "Gremlins") can steal intrinsics at night, so they can steal your intrinsic cold resistance. If you manage to get a gremlin to steal an undesired intrinsic like aggravate monster, that may also make you (the player, at least) feel "cool".                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that grid bugs only exist in a strictly Cartesian sense.                                                                      | Grid bugs can't move or attack on diagonals, so they can only move vertically (y-axis) and horizontally (x-axis).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that hackers often feel jumpy about eating nymphs.                                                                            | Eating a nymph may make you feel "jumpy" and gives you the [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis") intrinsic.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that having polymorph control won't shock you.                                                                                | You become immune to system-shock damage if you have polymorph control.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that if it's hard getting your food down another bite could kill.                                                             | If you have a hard time getting your food down and you continue eating, you could [choke](/wiki/Choke "Choke") over your food and die.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| They say that if you don't wear glasses why bother with carrots?                                                                       | Eating a carrot cures blindness. This rumor has nothing to do with lenses, which it predates.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| They say that if you notice a loose board beneath you, don't step on it.                                                               | Levitating or jumping over a squeaky board won't trigger it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| They say that if you start at the bottom the only place to go is up.                                                                   | Some levels have no down stairs, such as the bottom-most levels of the quest, mines, and Gehennom. A level teleport trap will always take you up on these levels.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that if you teleport to heaven you're presumed to be dead already.                                                            | Level teleporting to levels above 1 ends the game. Level -10 is heaven.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that in a shop you can be charged for old charges.                                                                            | If you die on a level with an angry shopkeeper, leave a bones file, then find that bones file on a subsequent game, the shopkeeper will still be angry.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that in lighter moments you could think of ways to pass a stone.                                                              | Loadstones are very heavy and usually cursed: once you pick it up you can't drop it. You can tell if a gray stone is a loadstone before picking it up by seeing how far you can kick it. There are several ways to get rid of one if you pick one up, such as getting a nymph to steal it, reading a scroll of remove curse, praying, etc. Also, you if you drop most of your items, you can squeeze past a boulder.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that in the dungeon breaking a mirror can be seven years bad luck.                                                            | Breaking a mirror by throwing it, kicking it, zapping it with a wand of striking, etc., decreases your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). Bad Luck times out eventually unless you are carrying a nonblessed luckitem.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| They say that in the dungeon you don't usually have any luck at all.                                                                   | Except on [a full moon or Friday the 13th](/wiki/Time "Time"), your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") starts at 0. Good and bad luck will time out eventually, unless you are carrying a nonblessed luckitem.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that in time a blessed luckstone can make your god happy.                                                                     | Carrying a noncursed luckstone raises your [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") and keeps good Luck from timing out. Praying with bad Luck has harmful effects.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that it is easier to kill the Wizard than to make him stand still.                                                            | You'll likely have to kill him several times. After you wake him, he'll teleport in to attack you wherever you are.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that it only takes 1 zorkmid to meet the Kops.                                                                                | Stealing even a cheap item or a single gold piece from a shop can bring the Keystone Kops.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that it's a blast when you mix the right potions together.                                                                    | Dipping one potion in another may cause an explosion. This rumor has nothing to do with potions of acid, which it predates.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that it's not blind luck if you catch a glimpse of Medusa.                                                                    | If you see Medusa you turn to stone. Try being blind or having [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that killing a shopkeeper brings bad luck.                                                                                    | Killing a shopkeeper is [murder](/wiki/Murder "Murder") (unless chaotic) and murder decreases your Luck.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that monsters never step on a scare monster scroll.                                                                           | Many monsters won't step on a [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster"), so you can fight more safely when standing on one, but ranged weapons and spells can still hit you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that most monsters find flute recitals extremely boring.                                                                      | A [magic flute](/wiki/Magic_flute "Magic flute") can put monsters to sleep. A [wooden flute](/wiki/Wooden_flute "Wooden flute") can make snakes peaceful.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that mummy corpses are not well preserved.                                                                                    | Corpses dropped by mummies and other undead start out 100 turns old, and will often be tainted.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that naturally a wand of wishing would be heavily guarded.                                                                    | There is a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") in the [castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"), along with lots of [soldiers](/wiki/Soldiers "Soldiers").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that no one notices the junk underneath a boulder.                                                                            | When a level is created, items may be randomly generated under boulders, but it isn't any more likely there than at any other spot. You may want to move boulders to check underneath, especially in Sokoban. Also, you can stow items under a boulder to keep them safe from all monsters except giants.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that nobody expects a unicorn horn to rust.                                                                                   | Unicorn horns are made of bone, not metal, so they are rustproof. You may want to wield one to fight a [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that nobody knows if an explorer can live forever. Do you?                                                                    | A good NetHack player may be able to live forever, but that would be very boring.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that nothing can change the fact that some potions contain a djinni.                                                          | Quaffing a [smoky potion](/wiki/Smoky_potion "Smoky potion") may release a [djinni](/wiki/Djinni "Djinni"), even if identified.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that nothing can change the fact that some potions contain a ghost.                                                           | Quaffing a [milky potion](/wiki/Milky_potion "Milky potion") may release a [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost"), even if identified.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| They say that nymphs always fall for rock'n'roll, try it!                                                                              | A [wooden harp](/wiki/Wooden_harp "Wooden harp") will pacify a nymph, if played with enough [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that once an Olog-Hai is canned it never shows its face again.                                                                | Olog-hai and other trolls can come back to life after being killed. One way to stop this is to tin their corpses with a [tinning kit](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say that once upon a time xans would never scratch your boots.                                                                    | The [xan](/wiki/Xan "Xan") has been able to [prick your legs](/wiki/Wounded_legs "Wounded legs") since the earliest days of [Andries Brouwer's Hack](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) However, there was no footwear in Hack and pre-3.0.0 NetHack, therefore a xan's attack did not give the message referring to your boots. To prevent a xan's pricking attack, you can [ride](/wiki/Riding "Riding") a steed, [levitate](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation"), or [fly](/wiki/Flying "Flying"). This will produce a message about the xan "try\[ing] to reach" your leg, and you won't get pricked.                                    |
| They say that only an experienced wizard can do the tengu shuffle.                                                                     | At level 8, wizards gain teleport at will if they have [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis"). At level 17 they gain [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| They say that only chaotics can kill shopkeepers and get away with it.                                                                 | Chaotic players aren't penalized for murdering peaceful humans.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that only female monsters can lay eggs.                                                                                       | You can polymorph into a female [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") monster and lay your own eggs. The hatchlings will be tame.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that playing a horn really bad is really good.                                                                                | If you improvise when applying a [tooled horn](/wiki/Tooled_horn "Tooled horn"), you produce a frightful sound that may scare nearby monsters, but will abuse your wisdom.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that problem breathing is best treated by a proper diet.                                                                      | If you eat too much, you'll [choke](/wiki/Choke "Choke") to death unless you have magical breathing.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that rubbing a glowing potion does not make it a magic lamp.                                                                  | Indeed, it does not.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that reading a scare monster scroll is the same as saying Elbereth                                                            | Reading a scare monster scroll can, predictably enough, scare nearby monsters. A scare monster scroll on the ground behaves almost the same as an "active" engraving of Elbereth.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that scalpels become dull because they're not athames.                                                                        | Noncursed athames don't get dull from engraving, and they can engrave up to 19 letters per turn. Other edged weapons do become dull from engraving.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that shopkeepers don't like pick-axes.                                                                                        | They won't let you in their shop if you have one visible. Consider putting it in a bag, dropping it at the door, or, if auto-pickup is turned on, throw it against the floor or wall while standing in the doorway, so you will automatically pick it up when you leave the shop.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that shopkeepers don't mind you bringing your pets in the shop.                                                               | Bringing a pet into a shop is one way to steal. When the pet picks up an item, it may carry it out or to the entrance.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| They say that shopkeepers don't usually mind if you sneak into a shop.                                                                 | You can teleport in without angering a shopkeeper, but the shopkeeper won't let you in if you are invisible.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| They say that shopkeepers often have a large amount of money in their purses.                                                          | True, and there are several ways to separate them from it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that shopkeepers often remember things that you might forget.                                                                 | If you get killed on a level with an angry shopkeeper, then play a new game as the same character and encounter that bones level, the shopkeeper will still be angry. Try taming. Or, if the shopkeeper won't let you leave the shop, it may be because you owe him money.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that sinks and armor don't mix, take your cloak off now!                                                                      | Quaffing from a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink") might [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") you. If you change into a [large](/wiki/Large "Large") monster, your [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"), and [shirt](/wiki/Shirt "Shirt") might get destroyed.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that sinks run hot and cold and many flavors in between.                                                                      | Drinking at a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink") can have the effect of quaffing a random potion.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that snake charmers aren't charismatic, just musical.                                                                         | Playing a [wooden flute](/wiki/Wooden_flute "Wooden flute") will pacify snakes.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that soldiers are always prepared and usually protected.                                                                      | [Soldiers](/wiki/Soldiers "Soldiers") often carry unique gear that is not random generated, such as K-rations and C-rations. They also get an assortment of non-magical armor and [offensive](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item")/[defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| They say that some eggs could hatch in your pack, lucky or not.                                                                        | Half of all eggs that hatch in a male player's pack will result in a pet. Otherwise, they can be peaceful or hostile.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that some fire ants will make you a hot meal.                                                                                 | Eating a [fire ant](/wiki/Fire_ant "Fire ant") corpse may grant [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that some horns play hot music and others are too cool for words.                                                             | An unidentified [fire](/wiki/Fire_horn "Fire horn") or [frost horn](/wiki/Frost_horn "Frost horn") looks like a [tooled horn](/wiki/Tooled_horn "Tooled horn").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that some humanoids are nonetheless quite human.                                                                              | Eating some humanoid corpses will count as [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism"). Humanoids generally count as intelligent monsters and can use magic items.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that some shopkeepers consider gems to be family heirlooms.                                                                   | [Gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), even unidentified glass, are ridiculously expensive in [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that some shopkeepers recognize gems but they won't tell you.                                                                 | Shopkeepers will always charge you for a gem as if it is valuable, but only buy them as if they are worthless glass (unless the gem is identified).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that some stones are much much heavier than others.                                                                           | Be sure not to pick up a [loadstone](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone") unless you have a way to uncurse it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| They say that some yetis are full of hot air.                                                                                          | Eating a [yeti](/wiki/Yeti "Yeti") corpse may grant [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that something very special would be in a well-protected place.                                                               | Most of the more difficult [special levels](/wiki/Special_level "Special level") have some kind of prize, such as the wand of wishing in the castle.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that speed boots aren't fast enough to let you walk on water.                                                                 | There are [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots"), however.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say that teleport traps are the devil's work.                                                                                     | In closets, they can lead to a [vault](/wiki/Vault "Vault"). They can help identify a [ring of teleport control](/wiki/Ring_of_teleport_control "Ring of teleport control") and provide an escape route.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that tengu don't wear rings, why should you?                                                                                  | Intrinsic [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") makes the [ring of teleport control](/wiki/Ring_of_teleport_control "Ring of teleport control") unnecessary.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that tengu never steal gold although they would be good at it.                                                                | [Teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis") and [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") help when robbing vaults.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| They say that that which was stolen once can be stolen again, ask any nymph.                                                           | You can steal your items back if you polymorph into a nymph. Usually, this is only an issue with an [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving"), as you can kill the nymph instead.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that the Delphic Oracle knows that lizard corpses aren't confusing.                                                           | Lizard corpses are always safe to eat, so they can never be rotten and cause confusion or unconsciousness, or food poisoning. Eating a lizard corpse while confused (or stunned) will cause that effect to wear off after 2 more turns. Their best use is to prevent [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning"), however.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that the Hand of Elbereth can hold up your prayers.                                                                           | Lawfuls get the title Hand of Elbereth when crowned. [Crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") greatly increases your prayer timeout.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say that the Leprechaun King is rich as Croesus.                                                                                  | A reference to [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus"), proprietor of the [vaults](/wiki/Vault "Vault"). You get rid of a vault guard by giving your name as "Croesus". This rumor has nothing to do with leprechaun halls or [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios"), both of which it predates.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that the Wizard of Yendor is schizophrenic and suicidal.                                                                      | The Wizard may cast [double trouble](/wiki/Double_trouble "Double trouble"), which looks as if he split himself. If one of the clones obtains the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), the other will attempt to retrieve it by force. This sadly does not lead to the Wizard "killing himself" since the wizard cannot harm monsters. All [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") monsters will retreat far later if wounded, and the Wizard has especially few [hit points](/wiki/Hit_point "Hit point").                                                                                                                  |
| They say that the experienced character knows how to convert an altar.                                                                 | Converting an altar is more likely to be successful when your character is a higher experience level. You can convert an altar by sacrificing on it while your alignment record is good.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that the gods are happy when they drop objects at your feet.                                                                  | Sometimes when you sacrifice or [prayer](/wiki/Pray "Pray") at an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar"), your god will give you a gift, usually an artifact weapon or a [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that the idea of invisible Nazguls has a certain ring to it.                                                                  | [Nazgul](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul") always carry a cursed [ring of invisibility](/wiki/Ring_of_invisibility "Ring of invisibility").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| They say that the lady of the lake now lives in a fountain somewhere.                                                                  | Lawful characters at level 5 or higher can dip an ordinary long sword in a fountain to get [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that the local shopkeeper frowns upon the rude tourist.                                                                       | Shopkeepers raise prices for low-level tourists or anyone wearing a visible Hawaiian shirt.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that the only door to the vampire's tower is on its lowest level.                                                             | You access [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower") by an extra staircase up.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that the only good djinni is a grateful djinni.                                                                               | Djinnis who are grateful to be released (from a [Magic lamp](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp") or [Potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion")) will grant you a wish. Other than that, there is no way to get a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") from a [djinni](/wiki/Djinni "Djinni").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| They say that the thing about genocide is that it works both ways.                                                                     | A [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") will summon 4-6 monsters of the specified type, known as [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide"). This can be quite useful, see the [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") article. Also, if you genocide @, you will die.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| They say that the unicorn horn rule is if it ain't broke then don't fix it.                                                            | Applying an uncursed [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") will only raise your [attributes](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute") to your previously-held maximum.
