Otherwise, "Nothing happens".                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that the view from a fog cloud is really very moving.                                                                         | Fog Clouds, along with vortices and some other monsters, have an [engulfing](/wiki/Engulfing "Engulfing") attack. They may move around while you are in them. See also: [Juiblex express](/wiki/Juiblex_express "Juiblex express").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that the walls in shops are made of extra hard material.                                                                      | Shop walls take longer than average to dig through. Any holes made in shop walls will automatically close up in the next five turns.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that there are at least 15 ways to lose a pair of levitation boots.                                                           | Some ways to remove cursed [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") gear: float over a sink, pray to get it uncursed, have it stolen by a nymph. See [curse removal](/wiki/Curse_removal "Curse removal") for more.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| They say that throwing glass gems is the same as throwing rocks.                                                                       | Both do the same amount of damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| They say that trespassing a boulder is probably beneath you.                                                                           | Unknown. Has nothing to do with Sokoban, which it predates. But if you drop all your items, you can squeeze past a boulder.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| They say that unicorns are fond of precious gems.                                                                                      | Throwing valuable gems at a co-aligned [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") will raise your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). Also, if a gem is type-named, any unicorn will refuse it as junk if it is glass, but keep it if it is valuable.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that prayer at an altar can sometimes make the water there holy.                                                              | Known as [water prayer](/wiki/Water_prayer "Water prayer"), any potions of water on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") will be blessed if the altar is coaligned and it is otherwise safe to pray.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that what goes down the drain might come back up.                                                                             | [Sinks](/wiki/Sink "Sink") are known to swallow rings (except slow digestion, searching, and a small chance for others), identifying it. Conversely, you can get one ring per sink from kicking it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that wielded, a long sword named Fire Brand makes you feel cooler.                                                            | As with most artifacts, [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand") grants resistance against its special type of damage: fire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that wielded, a long sword named Frost Brand makes you hot stuff.                                                             | As with most artifacts, [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand") grants resistance against its special type of damage: cold.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| They say that wiping its face is impossible for a floating eye.                                                                        | A [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye") does not have hands, and therefore cannot un-[blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") itself if you [cream pie](/wiki/Cream_pie "Cream pie") it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that with a floating eye you could see in the dark.                                                                           | Eating a floating eye corpse or polymorphing into one will always give you [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| They say that you are lucky if you can get a unicorn to catch a ruby.                                                                  | If you throw a valuable gem at a co-aligned unicorn, that raises your [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). Also, you usually need some maneuvering to line up with a hostile unicorn; being [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible") or [fast](/wiki/Fast "Fast") helps.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| They say that you are what you eat.                                                                                                    | Some corpses may convey [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") properties when eaten. Eating a mimic corpse will cause you to mimic a pile of gold (or an orange) for a while. Eating a green slime will cause you to become one (unless prevented), which will end your game. Eating a giant corpse can make you stronger.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| They say that you can find named weapons at an altar if you're lucky.                                                                  | Sometimes, sacrificing or praying at an altar will cause a god to give you an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that you can safely touch cockatrice eggs but why bother?                                                                     | Cockatrice [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg") (also known as "stoning grenades") can be wielded or thrown to turn monsters to stone. Unlike cockatrice corpses, handling the eggs with bare hands does not turn the player to stone.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that you can't break an amulet of reflection.                                                                                 | Mirrors break, but [amulets of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection") don't (no special attack destroys amulets). Both are useful against Medusa.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| They say that you don't always get what you wish for.                                                                                  | Certain items cannot be received from a wish, and wishes for artifacts may fail if at least two artifacts have already been generated. Wishes for stacks of stackable items and items with enchantment greater than zero also have their own special rules. See article [Wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| They say that you should always be prepared for a final challenge.                                                                     | The [Endgame](/wiki/Endgame "Endgame") and in particular the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") are much harder than the walk up with the Amulet. Also, the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") greets you one (hopefully last) time on the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth"). An [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") is practically a requirement to win the game.                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| They say that you should ask a dwarf to let you into a locked shop.                                                                    | Dwarves sometimes carry pick-axes or mattocks, which can dig through the walls of a shop. Note that shopkeepers won't allow you into the shop with a pick-axe or mattocks in your main inventory, but they can be smuggled into the shop in a container.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| They say that you should pray for divine inspiration.                                                                                  | [Prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") can reveal the passtune for the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| They say that you should religiously give your gold away.                                                                              | Donating to a temple priest has a variety of good results. See article [Aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| They say that you will never get healthy by eating geckos.                                                                             | Eating a gecko corpse won't give you poison resistance. [Lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") corpses have special properties, but this doesn't extend to geckos, iguanas, etc. Eating blue jellies, cave spiders, and several other types of corpses can grant poison resistance, which will give a message about feeling healthy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| They say that zapping yourself with a wand of undead turning is stupid.                                                                | Doing so revives the [lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") corpse you are always carrying around, and will stun you if you're polymorphed into an undead creature. Otherwise, it's harmless other than wasting a charge, and will even identify the wand if it was unidentified.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say the Wizard's castle is booby-trapped!                                                                                         | Unknown, but has nothing to do with the Wizard's Tower, which it predates.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| They say the gods get angry if you kill your dog.                                                                                      | Killing your pet by displacing it into a trap results in divine [anger](/wiki/Anger "Anger"). Killing it at all incurs an [alignment](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") and [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") penalty.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| They say the gods get angry if you pray too much.                                                                                      | After praying, you must wait for a while before being able to [pray](/wiki/Prayer_timeout "Prayer timeout") again successfully. If you pray too soon, your god will get [angry](/wiki/Angry "Angry") and may smite you, e.g. by draining a level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| They say there is a powerful magic item hidden in a castle deep down!                                                                  | There is a guaranteed [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") in the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Those who wield a cockatrice corpse have a rocky road ahead of them.                                                                   | Cockatrice corpses must be handled with extreme care to avoid the wielder turning to stone. But hitting a monster while wielding it will turn the monster to stone. Wearing gloves is required.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Throwing food at a wild dog might tame him.                                                                                            | Dogs and cats can be tamed with tripe, fresh corpses, or people food. If it becomes peaceful rather than tame, anger it and try again.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| To a full belly all food is bad.                                                                                                       | Eating while satiated risks choking to death for anyone and gives an [alignment](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") penalty to Knights.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Trolls are described as rubbery: they keep bouncing back.                                                                              | Troll corpses have a chance of reviving each turn. Partially eaten troll corpses revive partially damaged.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Try the fall-back end-run play against ghosts.                                                                                         | [Ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") are quite slow, so you can employ [hit and run](/wiki/Hit_and_run "Hit and run") tactics against them. Note that ghosts often indicate a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") level, beware of what killed the original player, and be cautious. Opponents in general will be adapted to the deceased player's difficulty.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Try using your magic marker on wet scrolls.                                                                                            | Dipping scrolls into a fountain, pool, moat, or potion of water will blank them. (BUC status is kept except sometimes for fountains.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Two wrongs don't make a right, but three lefts do.                                                                                     | One way to explore a level is to walk around the edges of the map and then to guess if/where anything in the middle could be.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| Unicorn horns can cleanse things other than yourself.                                                                                  | Intelligent pets will use a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") to cure various status ailments, and a [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn")'s horn will glow when it is cured of these.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Valkyries come from the north, and have commensurate abilities.                                                                        | [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") are [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") resistant.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Vampires hate garlic.                                                                                                                  | Standing on a clove of garlic or hitting them with it will scare vampires and other undead.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Vault guards never disturb their Lords.                                                                                                | Giving your name as [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus") to a [vault guard](/wiki/Vault_guard "Vault guard") gets rid of him (unless Croesus is dead).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Vegetarians enjoy lichen and seaweed.                                                                                                  | [Lichen](/wiki/Lichen "Lichen") corpses and [kelp fronds](/wiki/Kelp_frond "Kelp frond") are considered vegan.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| Visitors are requested not to apply genocide to shopkeepers.                                                                           | Because it wouldn't work anyway.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| Water traps have no effect on dragons.                                                                                                 | Dragon scales and dragon scale mail are rustproof.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| What is a cockatrice going to eat when it gets hungry?                                                                                 | Cockatrices are carnivorous, i.e. eat what a dog would. However, they usually stone opponents, leaving them without food.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| Who needs an apron if they're made of glass?                                                                                           | [Glass golems](/wiki/Glass_golem "Glass golem") are naturally resistant against [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") and [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| Why do you suppose they call them MAGIC markers?                                                                                       | Magic markers can be used to write scrolls or books of spells that you know on blank scrolls or spellbooks. There is a chance of success for unknown ones.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Why do you think they call them mercenaries?                                                                                           | You can bribe the [Yendorian army](/wiki/Yendorian_army "Yendorian army"), turning them peaceful. This does not work on the Minetown watch, however.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Why would anybody in his sane mind engrave " Elbereth "?                                                                               | Engraving [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") will protect you from most creatures, however, if engraved with your fingers in the dust, it degrades quickly. [Tooled horns](/wiki/Tooled_horn "Tooled horn") or [expensive cameras](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera") work on the rest.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Wishing too much may bring you too little.                                                                                             | You can specify quantity (for [stackable](/wiki/Stackable "Stackable") items) or [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") when [wishing](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for items. If you want too much, you will get the base version, or only one item. Wishing for 2 or 3, or +2 or +3, is usually best. For example, you could probably safely wish for "2 blessed +2 daggers".                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| You can't bribe soldier ants.                                                                                                          | But you can bribe the [Yendorian army](/wiki/Yendorian_army "Yendorian army"), turning them peaceful.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| You can't leave a shop through the back door: there isn't one!                                                                         | [Shops](/wiki/Shops "Shops") are always generated with only one exit.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| You may discover a fine spirit inside a potion bottle.                                                                                 | [Djinnis](/wiki/Djinni "Djinni") are sometimes released by quaffing smoky potions, and [ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") by quaffing milky potions.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| You may want to dip into a potion of bottled blessings.                                                                                | Dipping something in [holy water](/wiki/Holy_water "Holy water") will change its [BUC](/wiki/BUC "BUC") status. If cursed, it makes uncursed. If uncursed, it blesses it. This never blanks scrolls, rusts metal, dilutes potions, etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| You might be able to bribe a demon lord.                                                                                               | All named demons (except [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex") and [Orcus](/wiki/Orcus "Orcus")) will [demand payment](/wiki/Bribe "Bribe") for safe passage before attacking you if you encounter them in their lair.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| You might trick a shopkeeper if you're invisible.                                                                                      | Shopkeepers do not let you come in a shop while invisible. Wear a [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping") or [teleport](/wiki/Teleport "Teleport") in if you are invisible.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| You should certainly learn about quantum mechanics.                                                                                    | Quantum Mechanics are a type of monster. They may teleport you away when they hit you. Eating their corpses toggles intrinsic [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"). See article [Quantum mechanic](/wiki/Quantum_mechanic "Quantum mechanic").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| You won't always get a second chance, even with life saving.                                                                           | An [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving") doesn't cure brainlessness or genocide.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| You're going into the morgue at midnight???                                                                                            | Undead cause double damage from 0:00h to 1:00h (midnight to 1:00 AM).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Your dog knows what to eat; maybe you should take lessons.                                                                             | Pets will not eat poisonous, acidic, or hallucinogenic corpses. However, they will eat dogs and cats, which grant [aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster"), and your own race, which counts as [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| Zap yourself and see what happens...                                                                                                   | You can zap wands at yourself. Of course you might not want to try it with some wand types.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Zapping a wand of undead turning might bring your dog back to life.                                                                    | If it leaves a corpse, that is. There is a small chance it will come back hostile.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
